briefTitle: Omadacycline vs. Moxifloxacin for the Treatment of Community-Acquired Bacterial Pneumonia
officialTitle: A Phase 3b Randomized, Double-Blind, Multi-Center Study to Compare the Safety and Efficacy of Omadacycline IV/PO to Moxifloxacin IV/PO for Treating Adult Subjects With Community-Acquired Bacterial Pneumonia (CABP)
summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of omadacycline as compared to moxifloxacin in the treatment of adults with community-acquired bacterial pneumonia.

primaryOutcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Early Clinical Response at the Early Clinical Response (ECR) Visit
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: 72 to 120 hours after the first dose of test article
